results.title: The Trout harvest
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis, Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The Snobs Creek fish hatchery was newly established at this time, and this film shows how the fish are bred from the egg stage to liberation into rivers and lakes. This film was included in the San Francisco Film Festival 1961.

results.title: Life is More Pleasant with Wine
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents the joys of drinking wine, a harmonious accompaniment to many activities. Suggests times, places and accompaniments for wine; discusses the qualities and features of each type of wine, the type of glass required; and how best to serve it.

results.title: Five short films by Akram Zaatari
results.brief_description: Filmmaker and video artist Akram Zaatari was born in Saida, Lebanon in 1966 and currently lives in Beirut. His art practice also includes photography, installation, critical writing and curating. “Teach me”: By constructing new meaning out of recycled TV news footage, the filmmaker creates a thought-provoking statement against violence. “Countdown” This personal reflection on film and TV mixes footage of real-life war and reel entertainment. Zaatari explores our sense of real-time transmission and movement through space as we experience them in televised images of breaking news. “Gift” looks at Lebanon’s summertime beach boys. One boy begs the filmmaker to let him join the soccer players on the beach so he can be on TV. “Reflections”: Memories and images of childhood are reflected both on the screen and in the small mirror that a young boy plays with. “A family portrait” is a profile of a young, modern Lebanese family who are having their family photos taken. This multi-layered work examines the differences and similarities between real life and the synthetic world of TV and film. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Farewell to childhood
results.creator_credit: Julian Roffman, Herbert Kerkow and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows common problems of adolescents and their parents. A moody 15 year-old girl clashes with her parents when they frustrate her efforts to “run her own life”. Mistakes by the parents, such as scolding her in front of her young escort, widen the rift between parents and daughter. Conditions improve when the girl’s teacher arranges a thorough discussion of adolescent problems, bringing more tolerance to both sides.

results.title: Another day
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council, Jennie Blackwood and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Views of a number of people who have suffered from cancer leading normal happy lives. Stresses the importance of seeking medical advice and aid at the first suspicion that one has contracted the disease.

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: Everything under the sun [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Italian.
